text:
Under Windows 2000, the ant.bat script does not function correctly.  The nature 
of the problem stemps from the quotations around fields on the java command 
line.  Removing the quotes solved the problem.
creator: mark@questdatasolutions.com
stevel@apache.org
text:
the quotes are there for all the people who have spaces in their filenames, and
future ant versions will quote even more stuff. So the quote marks are staying,
and they work for everyone else.

is there something odd about your classpath, or value of ANT_HOME? Why not post
your env settings to the list to see if we can point out trouble

creator: conor@apache.org
text:
The most common problem is where the environment variables are themselves
quoted. The doubling up of quotes is generally the problem. Environment
variables do not need to be quoted. It is better to quote at the point of use.

creator: mark@questdatasolutions.com
text:
Strangely enough...i could not get this to work without fixing those darned 
quotes...but going back and editing them back in now...fixed it... I only 
changed my JAVA_HOME to jdk1.3 instead of 1.4....

sorry for the interruption and useless waste of bandwidth.  this one is closed.
